qas.question: Who had the least amount of backers, between Kerry and Dean?
Which state was expected to show the least amount of support for Kerry going into the caucuses, before Iowa?
What act showed that Kerry's fight for the White House was in trouble?

answers.text: he fired campaign manager Jim Jordan

qas.question: Who took over for Jim Jordon, when he was fired?
What regulation did Kerry not follow to try to save his campaign?

answers.text: mortgaging his own home to lend the money to his campaign

qas.question: What did Ted Kennedy have fewer of than Kerry in 2004?
What was Ted Kennedy's position in the superdelegate race in 2004?

plausible_answers.text: Iowa, New Hampshire, Arizona, South Carolina, New Mexico and Nevada.

qas.question: What states did Ted Kennedy lead in in 2004?
What was one area that Kennedy was seen as being weak in?
What position was held by Jim Jordan when he was fired by Bill Bradley?

context: In sheer numbers, <a0_0>Kerry<a0_0/> had fewer <b5_0>endorsements<b5_0/> than Howard Dean, who was <b6_0>far ahead<b6_0/> in the superdelegate race going into the Iowa caucuses in January 2004, although Kerry led the endorsement race in <b7_0>Iowa, New Hampshire, Arizona, South Carolina, New Mexico and Nevada.<b7_0/> Kerry's main perceived weakness was in his neighboring state of <a1_0>New Hampshire<a1_0/> and nearly <b8_0>all national polls<b8_0/>. Most other states did not have updated polling numbers to give an accurate placing for the Kerry campaign before Iowa. Heading into the primaries, Kerry's campaign was largely seen as in trouble, particularly after <a2_0>he fired <b9_0>campaign manager<b9_0/> Jim Jordan<a2_0/>. The key factors enabling it to survive were when fellow Massachusetts Senator Ted Kennedy assigned <a3_0>Mary Beth Cahill<a3_0/> to be the campaign manager, as well as Kerry's <a4_0>mortgaging his own home to lend the money to his campaign<a4_0/> (while his wife was a billionaire, campaign finance rules prohibited using one's personal fortune). He also brought on the "magical" Michael Whouley who would be credited with helping bring home the Iowa victory the same as he did in New Hampshire for Al Gore in 2000 against Bill Bradley.
